basics.name: Gabriel Windlin
basics.label: CS Student and Tech enthusiast
basics.summary: Computer Science student at ETH Zürich. I'm most interested in Cyber Security, Machine Learning, Software Development and Architecture. I am always open to collaborating on interesting projects or discussing new ideas in tech. Feel free to connect!

work.name: VIS ETHZ
work.summary: Deploying Applications and helping to manage the VIS clusters.
highlights: Deployed 'Rallly' on the association's local cluster using Kubernetes.
Configured container orchestration and networking for self-hosted student services.
maintained and monitored on-premise server resources.

work.name: PureGym
work.summary: Ensuring operational excellence and member support.
highlights: Assisted with front desk operations and check-ins.
Maintained environment safety and equipment functionality.

work.name: Skills Park
highlights: Optimized workflow efficiency with team members.
Managed cash drawer accounting and customer needs.

projects.name: sec-suite
projects.description: Comprehensive security testing toolkit for password auditing and network analysis.
highlights: Advanced password cracking (Markov, Dictionary).
Multi-threaded brute force engine.
Modern hash support (bcrypt, argon2) & keylogger.

projects.name: port-scanner
projects.description: High-performance, single-file TCP scanner written in C using non-blocking I/O.
highlights: Uses non-blocking sockets and select() for precise timeouts.
Implements EINPROGRESS handling for robust async connections.
Zero external dependencies.

projects.name: matrix-calculator
projects.description: A Java-based tool for performing complex matrix operations.
highlights: Supports matrix addition, subtraction, and multiplication.
Built with pure Java.
Currently being refactored for deployment.

projects.name: dotfiles
projects.description: My personal system configurations and development environment setup.
highlights: Neovim, Zsh, and Hyprland configurations.
Automated installation scripts.
Documentation site available.

projects.name: chat-app
projects.description: A basic, single-connection TCP chat application implemented in C that demonstrates fundamental socket programming concepts.
highlights: Implemented in C with POSIX sockets.
Demonstrates fundamental TCP/IP concepts.
Single-server, single-client architecture.

projects.name: screen-savor
projects.description: A captivating web experiment that transforms your browser into a canvas for generative art.
highlights: Browse the latest trending and top-rated movies.
Search for any film and preview its trailers.
Built with React, JS, CSS and HTML for a smooth experience.

projects.name: flowstate
projects.description: A productivity tool designed to help maintain focus and workflow efficiency.
highlights: Workflow optimization features.
Under active development.
Upcoming deployment.
